abstract: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine issues report on technology known as gene drive, which gives humans power to alter entire species, and endorse continuing research on it; report points out that not enough is known about unintended consequences of technology, but endorsement will likely lead to new funding and to new considerations about its regulation across globe.

headline.print_headline: Species-wide Gene Editing, Applauded and Feared, Gets a Push
headline.main: Panel Endorses ‘Gene Drive’ Technology That Can Alter Entire Species

keywords.value: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A technique to change or eliminate entire populations of organisms could be used against virus-carrying mosquitoes. It could also have unintended consequences.
lead_paragraph: A technique to change or eliminate entire populations of organisms could be used against virus-carrying mosquitoes. It could also have unintended consequences.
